title: Warning for useContext second argument confusing for library users
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

Not exactly a bug, but a confusing error message.

**What is the current behavior?**

When the second argument is passed to `useContext` (`unstable_observedBits`), we get a [warning message informing that this second argument is unsupported](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/14729). Yet this argument ***is*** used by third-party libraries, relied upon by React users.

So these users will wind up seeing this warning and not really have any power to do anything about it (for instance, [here](https://github.com/dai-shi/react-hooks-global-state/issues/5)).

If the intention is that `unstable_observedBits` should ***not*** be used by library authors, I'd appreciate some clear communication on what the alternative API will be.

`unstable_observedBits` now has moderate adoption among third party libraries for the `Context.Consumer` variant and my expectation would be that a parallel API is supported for `useContext`, at least to the minimal extent that downstream users aren't receiving non-actionable error messages.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
React 16.8+.
